# Si Lila at ang kanyang laban

Written by Jamilla Marie Matias • Board by Joseph Andrei Torres | 18 April 24

Katumbas ni Lila ang isang mayuming bulaklak. May samyo ng katangiang walang
katulad, may kagandahang ‘di maikubli at maipaliwanag. Simbolo siya ng
dignidad at kalakasan, larawan ng pagtindig sa anumang laban. Handang ibuwis
ang kanyang buhay para sa adhikaing matamo ang pagkakapantay-pantay. Busalan
man ang bibig, si Lila ay hindi padadaig. Handang ihayag ang tinig sa lipunang
kung ituring siya’y sanggol lamang na tumataghoy at tumatangis.

Sagrado man ang kanyang kinalakhan, sinubukan man siyang ikubli sa tahanan,
pinaniwalang siya’y utusan lamang. Ngunit si Lila ay may tapang, may
paninindigan at prinsipyong pinanghahawakan. Ika niya’y babae ako’t hindi
babae lamang at kaya kong makipagsabayan, kahit pa sa macho-pyudal mang
lipunan pa ‘yan.

Hinulma siya sa aparador na may samu’t saring kasuotan. Katuwang niya ang
pananamit sa paghayag ng kanyang sariling pagkakakilanlan. Mga haragang
nagmamasid-masid habang mga mata’y nanlilisik sa kung paano si Lila manamit,
dahilan kung bakit kalayaan ng dalaga’y nasasaid. Ngunit batid ni Lila ang
katotohanang hindi siya ang may mali, kundi ang lipunang tingin sa mga
kababaiha’y laruan lamang na may mababang uri.

Danas din ni Lila ang iba’t ibang hinaing. Na ang tulad niyang dilag ay wala
raw mararating; na ang isang kagaya niya’y litrato lamang sa dingding —
palamuti lamang kung ituring. Subalit taliwas sa bawat daing, ang katotohanang
si Lila ay may matayog na lipad din. Bakas sa nangungusap na mata ang pangarap
na parang isang makinang na bituin. May kakayahang hindi padadaig sapagkat
alam niyang siya ay may puwang sa daigdig.

Araw-araw namumulat sa reyalidad si Lila. Maraming tanong ang sa kaniya’y
umuusisa gaya ng katanungang bakit nga ba umiiral pa rin ang karahasan sa mga
kababaihan sa kabila ng layo ng narating ng kanyang pakikibaka?

umuusisa gaya ng katanungang bakit nga ba umiiral pa rin ang karahasan sa mga
kababaihan sa kabila ng layo ng narating ng kanyang pakikibaka? Kung kaya’t
bitbit niya sa bawat oras ang mga aral buhat ng kanyang karanasan sa lipunang
talimangmang. Salamin sa kanyang patuloy na paghamon — determinadong baguhin
ang ihip ng tila pasistang panahon. Kalakip ang kanyang layunin na siya nawang
waksiin ang istigma sa mga kababaihan, kung mamarapatin. Dahil higit sa
mayuming mala-bulaklak ang dating, ang mga babae’y may uri ng lakas na
kailanman ay hindi kukupas, ano mang pagdarahop ang dumating.

# When One is More than Many: The Story Behind Micah Salonoy’s Capstone
Project

Written by Eunice Anny Morales and Charyll Joan Pascua • Board by Mary Joy Cerniaz | 13 July 23

Since day one, she knew her dream would entail facing giant obstacles. Yet,
she also knew that her dream would always dwarf the challenges she must
encounter.

A crowd wildly cheering, a thousand hands clapping, medals clinking–all of the
things that are happening seem to be elements for a perfect triumphant scene.
But among the crowd, there she was; standing, sulking, and repeatedly uttering
“How ironic!” at the back of her mind. How ironic it was for her to be
surrounded by applauding people while she was feeling the exact opposite. She
felt downright defeated, unable to secure her dream of participating in the
National Schools Press Conference (NSPC). It was even more hurtful to suffer
such a loss as the editor-in-chief of her high school because she just knew
her peers back on campus had pinned their hopes on her victory.

She moped for a little more: as she sat on the bus, as she watched buildings
move past her sight from the window seat, as her family cheered her up at
dinner. She sympathized with her heavy heart until the lights in her room were
shut off. But just as the day neared its end, a flicker of resilience ignited
within her, refusing to succumb to defeat. Being the nonconformist that she
is, she realized that her journalistic journey extended far beyond the
confines of national competitions.

Journalism is alive and is practiced in all parts of the world. “Hence, why
should I only settle for the nationals?” she pondered in introspection. The
thought consumed her throughout that night, and with fervor, she made the
life-changing decision to elevate her dreams to becoming a foreign
correspondent. She believed that by doing so, she could provide a way for
Filipinos abroad to impart their stories and connect them with their homeland
albeit being far. Truth be told, this decision wasn't born overnight. It had
lingered in her mind for quite some time, but that evening marked the turning
point where she committed wholeheartedly to her new path. Her parents'
experience as Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs), the inspiring journalists like
Howard Johnson of BBC News and Maria Ressa from her own country, all played a
part in shaping her resolve.

Micah understood by heart that to reap with certainty meant to sow
effortfully. With this, she embarked on her journey by equipping herself with
the necessary skills, particularly immersing herself in foreign languages.
Starting with Spanish, she delved into German, and then the Japanese language.
With whatever resources she could gather, from textbooks to YouTube videos,
she dedicated her days–her years–trying to master them as well as learning
more languages. Yet, understanding the language was only the first step;
comprehending the people comes next. Recognizing this, Micah understood that
firsthand interaction with individuals from different countries was crucial.

Her parents'
experience as Overseas Filipino Workers (OFWs), the inspiring journalists like
Howard Johnson of BBC News and Maria Ressa from her own country, all played a
part in shaping her resolve.

Micah understood by heart that to reap with certainty meant to sow
effortfully. With this, she embarked on her journey by equipping herself with
the necessary skills, particularly immersing herself in foreign languages.
Starting with Spanish, she delved into German, and then the Japanese language.
With whatever resources she could gather, from textbooks to YouTube videos,
she dedicated her days–her years–trying to master them as well as learning
more languages. Yet, understanding the language was only the first step;
comprehending the people comes next. Recognizing this, Micah understood that
firsthand interaction with individuals from different countries was crucial.
And so, she saw the opportunity provided by the Asia Kakehashi Project (AKP),
an initiative which offers a 10-month exchange program cycle in Japan, as her
avenue to achieve this.

Micah took the initial steps applying for AKP. Despite fierce competition, she
successfully passed the first screening, validating her potential. Fueled by
renewed hope, she pressed forward, navigating the interview rounds with
unwavering confidence. However, fate dealt her a different hand as she found
herself selected as an alternative rather than a participant. Undeterred,
Micah refused to let go of her dreams.

With her determination intact, Micah applied once more for the next batch of
the mentioned project. Showcasing her unwavering spirit, she triumphed in the
first screening yet again. Advancing to the interview rounds, her hopes soared
high, only to be dashed as she found herself in the same position as before—an
alternative rather than a participant. The weight of disappointment loomed
over Micah, threatening to engulf her. Rather than taking firm strides,
journeying suddenly seemed like restlessly walking on thin ice that's on the
verge of being shattered.

Just when she believed her dream was slipping away, a glimmer of opportunity
materialized. Out of the blue, a message from her exchange student sponsor
appeared, inquiring if she was still interested in the program. Filled with
doubts and hesitations, Micah initially responded with a reluctant "no."
However, her sponsor, recognizing her potential and tenacity, persisted,
urging her to reconsider. They assured her that a spot had opened up, finally
granting Micah the chance to resume taking steps towards her long-awaited
dream. Overwhelmed with joy, her spirit soared, reigniting her drive to
conquer any obstacles that lay ahead.

Sadly, the world had different plans in store. As Micah's departure from the
Philippines to Japan drew near, the COVID-19 pandemic swept across the globe,
disrupting plans and shattering dreams. The anticipated April departure faded
into a distant hope, postponed to November due to travel restrictions and
safety concerns. Micah's patience faced yet another test, but she refused to
let despair consume her.

As November approached, Micah mentally and emotionally prepared herself for
the long-awaited journey. However, the universe seemed determined to test her
resilience one final time. A routine COVID-19 test revealed that Micah had
tested positive, once again threatening to derail her plans. Her heart sank,
but she resolved to confront this challenge head-on. Isolating herself and
focusing on her recovery, Micah eagerly awaited the second test, holding her
breath in anticipation.

Finally, the moment of truth arrived. The results of the second test brought a
wave of relief and elation—Micah had tested negative. With renewed purpose and
an unyielding spirit, she boarded the plane, ready to embrace the
transformative experience that awaited her in Japan.

Her time as an exchange student proved to be a catalyst for her ambitions,
reaffirming her passion for journalism. Immersed in a new culture, she
absorbed invaluable insights, connected with people from diverse backgrounds,
and witnessed the power of multicultural narratives in bridging gaps and
fostering understanding. Most importantly, her journey reminded her once again
of the significance of journalism in shaping perspectives and driving positive
change.

Upon returning to her homeland in March of last year, Micah was fueled by a
strong desire to make a lasting impact in her chosen field. Motivated by her
experiences, she embarked on a journey to create a significant project, later
known as the "**ISKOMMpanion Project** ," that would not only enhance her
skills but also contribute meaningfully to the field of journalism.

reaffirming her passion for journalism. Immersed in a new culture, she
absorbed invaluable insights, connected with people from diverse backgrounds,
and witnessed the power of multicultural narratives in bridging gaps and

Upon returning to her homeland in March of last year, Micah was fueled by a
strong desire to make a lasting impact in her chosen field. Motivated by her
experiences, she embarked on a journey to create a significant project, later
known as the "**ISKOMMpanion Project** ," that would not only enhance her
skills but also contribute meaningfully to the field of journalism. Despite
the demands of being a student at Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila (PLM),
Micah dedicated herself to conceptualizing and refining her project over
several months.

Now, the unwavering commitment and tireless efforts in developing her capstone
project are paying off. Micah's exceptional dedication has led to her being
chosen as a delegate for the 28th Session of The Youth Assembly in New York,
scheduled for August 11 to 13. This prestigious opportunity will allow her to
showcase her project among individuals from around the world, fortifying her
passion for journalism and presenting her ideas to a global audience.

Since day one, she knew her dream would entail facing giant obstacles. Yet,
she also knew that her dream would always dwarf the challenges she must
encounter. With unwavering commitment, Micah relentlessly pursues her goal,
reminding us all that one can be more than many—In her case, the passion for
journalism is more than many struggles.
